channel.title: Multiple Choice Quiz (CLOSE PLZ TY LY PENIS)
channel.description:
[s]Can someone explain to me the logic behind programming a multiple choice quiz where the answers "positions" are randomised eg. Not always A.
Please try to make it applicable to any programming language and focus more on what needs to be done rather than exactly how to do it.
Thanks :D![/s]
Found the solution... close this shit ya.

item.title: Multiple Choice Quiz (CLOSE PLZ TY LY PENIS)
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

If you’re using a collection to hold the data (ArrayList, Vector, etc.), it would be fairly easy.

Get random one, pop it off of the collection,
redefine what “random” is,
pop off next
…

Read full topic

item.title: Multiple Choice Quiz (CLOSE PLZ TY LY PENIS)
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

I’m not really sure what you’re asking - do you want to know how to implement this?

For each question you could have an array containing the 5 choices. Then generate a random number between 0 and 4 which refers to an element in the array.

Like in Java, you’d do something like this:

String[] answers = {"A", "B", "C", "D", "E"};
Random r = new Random();
int index = r.nextInt(5);
String answer = answers[index];

Read full topic
